de.team33.libs.testing.v1

Interface Attempts<X extends Exception>

  • Type Parameters:
    X - A type of (checked) exception that may occur while performing the operation.

    public interface Attempts<X extends Exception>
    Abstracts a tool for performing a certain operation repeatedly. Both parallel and serial execution are possible.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<Throwable> getCaught()
      Returns any exceptions that might have occurred while performing the associated operation.
      void reThrowCaught()
      Re-throws one of the exceptions that may have occurred while executing the associated operation.
      static <X extends Exception>
      Attempts<X>      		 runParallel(int count, XConsumer<Integer,X> xConsumer)
      Repeatedly performs a specific operation in parallel threads.

      Repeatedly performs a specific operation in parallel threads.

      Repeatedly performs a specific operation in the current thread.

    • Method Detail

      • tryParallel

        static <X extends Exception> void tryParallel(int count,
                                              XRunnable<X> xRunnable)
                                       throws X extends Exception
        Repeatedly performs a specific operation in parallel threads.
        Type Parameters:
        X - A type of (checked) exception that may occur while performing the operation.
        Parameters:
        count - the number of parallel threads
        xRunnable - the operation
        Throws:
        Error - if an Error occurred while performing the operation.
        RuntimeException - if a RuntimeException occurred while performing the operation.
        X - if an Exception of type <X> occurred while performing the operation.
        X extends Exception
        See Also:
        trySerial(int, XRunnable), tryParallel(int, XConsumer), runParallel(int, XRunnable)

      • tryParallel

        static <X extends Exception> void tryParallel(int count,
                                              XConsumer<Integer,X> xConsumer)
                                       throws X extends Exception
        Repeatedly performs a specific operation in parallel threads. In this variant, the operation receives a unique consecutive number as a parameter
        Type Parameters:
        X - A type of (checked) exception that may occur while performing the operation.
        Parameters:
        count - the number of parallel threads
        xConsumer - the operation
        Throws:
        Error - if an Error occurred while performing the operation.
        RuntimeException - if a RuntimeException occurred while performing the operation.
        X - if an Exception of type <X> occurred while performing the operation.
        X extends Exception
        See Also:
        trySerial(int, XConsumer), tryParallel(int, XRunnable), runParallel(int, XConsumer)

      • runParallel

        static <X extends Exception> Attempts<X> runParallel(int count,
                                                     XRunnable<X> xRunnable)
        Repeatedly performs a specific operation in parallel threads.
        Type Parameters:
        X - A type of (checked) exception that may occur while performing the operation.
        Parameters:
        count - the number of parallel threads
        xRunnable - the operation
        Returns:
        An instance of Attempts. This contains the exceptions that actually occurred during the execution of the operation.
        See Also:
        runSerial(int, XRunnable), runParallel(int, XConsumer), tryParallel(int, XRunnable)

      • runParallel

        static <X extends Exception> Attempts<X> runParallel(int count,

      • reThrowCaught

        void reThrowCaught()
            throws X extends Exception
        Re-throws one of the exceptions that may have occurred while executing the associated operation.
        Throws:
        Error - if an Error occurred while performing the operation.
        RuntimeException - if a RuntimeException occurred while performing the operation.
        X - if an Exception of type <X> occurred while performing the operation.
